entry.title: DFA, Red Cross want to give coronavirus test results directly to repatriated OFWs | Teleradyo

media:group.media:title: DFA, Red Cross want to give coronavirus test results directly to repatriated OFWs | Teleradyo
media:group.media:description:
Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. said he was working with the Philippine Red Cross to give the results of the coronavirus tests it conducts directly to repatriated migrant workers, following reports that some of them were quarantined 4 times longer than the required 14-days.

entry.title: 300 buses to ply Metro Manila when general quarantine starts: DILG | Teleradyp

media:group.media:title: 300 buses to ply Metro Manila when general quarantine starts: DILG | Teleradyp
media:group.media:description:
Some 300 point-to-point buses will be allowed to ferry passengers in Metro Manila on June 1, the first day of its looser general community quarantine or GCQ, a member of an inter-agency task force on the pandemic.

media:group.media:description:

entry.title: Public transport to resume in 2 phases under general quarantine | Teleradyo

media:group.media:title: Public transport to resume in 2 phases under general quarantine | Teleradyo
media:group.media:description:

entry.title: New normal for MRT: Fewer passengers, train marshals, temp checks | Teleradyo

media:group.media:title: New normal for MRT: Fewer passengers, train marshals, temp checks | Teleradyo
media:group.media:description:
The MRT-3, the capital's busiest train line, will resume its operations on Monday with fewer passengers per train, marshals who will monitor coronavirus protocols, and temperature checks for passengers.
